Comments: No indication that they are monitoring if/how changes in their business operations are impacting the risk of modern slavery in their operations. Laureen van Breen[https://wikirate.org/Laureen_van_Breen].....2018-05-30 11:12:27 UTC

Metric: Business & Human Rights Resource Centre+MSA homepage link (archived)
Comments: Link available on the "Sourcing" page, toward the bottom. Laureen van Breen[https://wikirate.org/Laureen_van_Breen].....2018-05-30 10:20:30 UTC
Toward the bottom of pg 3 the statement clarifies that they have identified "wild fish suppliers" as high risk. Laureen van Breen[https://wikirate.org/Laureen_van_Breen].....2018-05-30 10:46:46 UTC
No specific incidents are discussed in the statement. Laureen van Breen[https://wikirate.org/Laureen_van_Breen].....2018-05-30 10:48:18 UTC

While the statement gives a lot of information about the measures NESI takes to avoid modern slavery, monitor risk, and promote ethical behavior, no details are provided about the remediation of incidents. Laureen van Breen[https://wikirate.org/Laureen_van_Breen].....2018-05-30 10:55:57 UTC
Page four, last paragraph. Erik Ols[https://wikirate.org/Erik_Ols].....2017-11-06 20:33:00 UTC
